intro: Psychotria maroensis, commonly known as the Maroense Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the rainforests of Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Psychotria maroensis is also noted for its chemical composition, containing alkaloids that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
